DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not an individual visited the National Institutes of Health (NIH) specifically to enroll in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Enrollment National Institutes of Health Patient Visit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

Property.preferredName: National Institutes of Health Patient Visit
Property.preferredDefinition: A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov.:A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.

Concepts.definition: A federal agency in the U.S. that conducts biomedical research in its own laboratories; supports the research of non-Federal scientists in universities, medical schools, hospitals, and research institutions throughout the country and abroad; helps in the training of research investigators; and fosters communication of medical information. Access the National Institutes of Health Web site at http://www.nih.gov.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.
